author: The Editorial Board
title: China’s Anbang Warning
text:
Beijing’s takeover of Anbang Insurance Group on Friday is an encouraging sign that Chinese regulators are serious about reducing risks to the financial system. But are they doing enough? Since the 2008 global financial panic, a massive debt increase has fueled China’s economic growth, and now borrowing costs are rising. Anbang could be the tip of a Titanic-sized iceberg of malinvestment.
Anbang began to go off the rails in spectacular fashion four years ago. The company sold high-risk, high-return investment products to Chinese...
